commit_message:
Trimming adapters and low quality base calls

Trimming is an important step when the reads sequences have adapters not removed and low-quality regions. Trimmomatic is a commonly used tool for this purpose, and in this code, we use it to remove the Illumina adapters and low quality base calls. This shell script will produce four output files for each sample.

Merge pull request #1 from IGcodes/Edit1

Edit1

Update and rename extraction.sh to step5_extraction.sh

Added the explanation to the extraction of specific regions of bam files

Update sortNindex.sh

Added a description of the sort and index functions in samtools and explained how it is being used in this shell script.

Update align.sh

Added detailed description of the for loop and alignment process.

Update download.sh

fastq-dump function and for loop were described in details

Update QC.sh

Made new comments for the QC.sh file and placeholders were positioned at the places the code should be changed.
